heading: # Navigation drawers
headingText: The `v-navigation-drawer` component is what your users will utilize to navigate through the application. The navigation-drawer is pre-configured to work with or without **vue-router** right out the box. For the purpose of display, some examples are wrapped in a `v-card` element. Within your application you will generally place the `v-navigation-drawer` as a direct child of `v-app`.

usage.desc: The navigation drawer is primarily used to house links to the pages in your application. Using `null` as the starting value for its `v-model` will initialize the drawer as closed on mobile and as open on desktop. It is common to pair drawers with the [v-list](/components/lists) component using the **nav** property.

colored.heading: ### Colored drawer
colored.desc: Navigation drawers can be customized to fit any application's design. Here we apply a custom background color and an appended content area using the **append** slot.

permanent-floating.heading: ### Permanent floating drawer
permanent-floating.desc: By default, a navigation drawer has a 1px right border that separates it from content. In this example we want to detach the drawer from the left side and let it float on its own. The **floating** property removes the right border (or left if using **right**).

mini.heading: ### Mini
mini.desc: When using the **mini-variant** prop, the drawer will shrink (default 80px) and hide everything inside of `v-list` except the first element. In this example we use the **.sync** modifier that allows us to tie the expanding/contracting of the drawer programmatically.

temporary.heading: ### Temporary
temporary.desc: A temporary drawer sits above its application and uses a scrim (overlay) to darken the background. This drawer behavior is mimicked by default when on mobile. Clicking outside of the drawer will cause it to close.

combined.heading: ### Combined drawers
combined.desc: In this example we define a custom width to accommodate our nested drawer. Using `v-row` we ensure that the drawer and list stack horizontally next to each other.

right.heading: ### Right positioned
right.desc: Navigation drawers can also be positioned on the right side of your application (or an element). This is also useful for creating a side-sheet with auxillary information that may not have any navigation links. When using **RTL** you must explicitly define **right** for your drawer.

background.heading: ### Backgrounds
background.desc: Apply a custom background to your drawer. If you need to customize `v-img`'s properties you can use the **img** slot.

bottom-drawer.heading: ### Bottom drawer
bottom-drawer.desc: Using the **bottom** prop, we are able to relocate our drawer on mobile devices to come from the bottom of the screen. This is an alternative style and only activates once the **mobile-break-point** is met.

expand-on-hover.heading: ### Expand on hover
expand-on-hover.desc: Places the component in **mini-variant** mode and expands once hovered. Does not alter the content area. Width can be controlled with the **mini-variant-width** property.

props.bottom: Expands from the bottom of the screen on mobile devices
props.clipped: A clipped drawer rests under the application toolbar
props.disableResizeWatcher: Will automatically open/close drawer when resized depending if mobile or desktop.
props.disableRouteWatcher: Disables opening of navigation drawer when route changes
props.expandOnHover: Collapses the drawer to a **mini-variant** until hovering with the mouse
props.floating: A floating drawer has no visible container (no border-right)
props.height: Sets the height of the navigation drawer
props.miniVariantWidth: Designates the width assigned when the `mini` prop is turned on
props.miniVariant: Condenses navigation drawer width, also accepts the **.sync** modifier. With this, the drawer will re-open when clicking it
props.permanent: The drawer remains visible regardless of screen size
props.right: Places the navigation drawer on the right
props.stateless: Remove all automated state functionality (resize, mobile, route) and manually control the drawer state
props.temporary: A temporary drawer sits above its application and uses a scrim (overlay) to darken the background

events.transitionend: Emits event object when transition is complete.

slots.append: A slot at the bottom of the drawer
slots.img: Used to modify `v-img` properties when using the **src** prop
slots.prepend: A slot at the top of the drawer

alert: If you are using `v-navigation-drawer` with `app` property enabled, you don't need to use `absolute` prop as in examples.
